CASE HAVING BEEN FINALLY HEARD ON 08.01.2021, ALONG WITH Cr1.MC.3341/2017, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: a Crl.MC.NoS.3341/2017 & 3343 OF 2017 202 1IKERIT225 3 ORDER [ Crl.M.C.No.3341/2017 and Crl1.M.C.No.3343/2017 ] Dated this the 8th day of January 2021 These Crl.M.Cs are filed with a prayer to issue appropriate direction to the 2 respondent to report the seizure of the vehicles of the petitioners to the Jurisdictional Magistrate and to direct the learned Magistrate to release the vehicles to the petitioners unconditionaly. 2. These Crl.M.Cs are pending from 2017 onwards. When these cases came up for consideration, the learned counsel for the petitioners submitted that the petitioners may be given liberty to approach the geologist concerned for compounding the offence under Section 23A of the Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation)Act and Rule 60A of the Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Rules. Eo el arte Bl amen Crl.MC.NoS.3341/2017 & 3343 OF 2017 2021/RER/1225 4 Therefore, these Crl.M.Cs are closed with liberty to the petitioners to approach the competent authority in accordance to law if they are adviced so, if such an application is permissible legally.
